newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: DON SELLS FOOD INTERESTS, TO TAP MARKET.
newsitem.headline: DON SELLS FOOD INTERESTS, TO TAP MARKET.

text.p: South African hotel firm Don Group Ltd said on Monday that it had agreed to sell its food interests to various buyers for an undisclosed sum.
The firm also announced that it would launch a right issue of shares to raise 65 million rand in order to cut its debt.

"With the disposal of the food interests, the group will have removed a loss-incurring burden while the planned rights issue would immediately reduce gearing and interest charges amounting to 12 million rand annually," director Paul Nash in a statement.
He said the company expected better financial results for 1997/98.

"The pick up in occupancies as well as strong forward bookings for the rest of the year is encouraging," added Nash, who is also managing director of Don Group's 40 percent shareholder Sable Holdings Ltd.
The group posted earnings per share of 30.39 cents for the year to June 30, 1996 but has yet to announce its 1996/97 results.
Sable chairman John Nash said his company was considering underwriting all of the Don Group's planned rights issue and he expected the issue to be completed within six weeks.
Paul Nash said Don Group's food interests had been sold to different buyers with effective dates from July 1 to December 30. There were no further details given on the identity of the buyers.
